content.raw:
OK, I ran the integration tests one by one and they seem to work. I still have some questions before approving this pull request:

* I see the following messages in some of the tests:

```
#!c++
(SelectInput) select failed Success
error receiving msg!
```
Is this expected? If not, can we change/remove the message, it's confusing.

* Usually, a line after loading the world, such as:

`this->world->Step(1)`

triggers the load of the plugins by the physics. This is a good idea because after that, you know that your plugin is running, otherwise you don't have guarantees.

If I enable this line in `run_agent.cc::TestLoadConnectAgent`, the test fails which make me think that we might have some problem or in the test or in the code. jasonzliang, could you take a look at this?

* I can load a team of agents using the utaustinvilla script. If I'am not wrong this is loading the Aldebaran Nao model. How can I test the Nao type Zero model?
content.html:
OK, I ran the integration tests one by one and they seem to work. I still have some questions before approving this pull request:

  • I see the following messages in some of the tests:
(SelectInput) select failed Success
error receiving msg!

Is this expected? If not, can we change/remove the message, it's confusing.

  • Usually, a line after loading the world, such as:

this->world->Step(1)

triggers the load of the plugins by the physics. This is a good idea because after that, you know that your plugin is running, otherwise you don't have guarantees.

If I enable this line in run_agent.cc::TestLoadConnectAgent, the test fails which make me think that we might have some problem or in the test or in the code. jasonzliang, could you take a look at this?

  • I can load a team of agents using the utaustinvilla script. If I'am not wrong this is loading the Aldebaran Nao model. How can I test the Nao type Zero model?
